org.chronos.chronodb.internal.api

Interface Lockable.LockHolder

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractLockHolder, BasicLockHolder
    Enclosing interface:
    Lockable

    public static interface Lockable.LockHolder
extends java.lang.AutoCloseable
    A Lockable.LockHolder is an object that represents ownership over some sort of Lock.

    The basic idea here is to have a lock representatin that implements AutoCloseable and can therefore work with the try-with-resources statement.

    In general, a class making use of LockHolders should offer factory methods for the locks. These factories should create a new lock holder (e.g. via createBasicLockHolderFor(Lock), then call acquireLock() on it before returning it. The caller can then use the following pattern: 

     try (LockHolder lock = theThingToBeLocked.lockFactoryMethod()) {

        // work in locked state here

 } // lock.close() is automatically invoked here, calling lock.release()

    Please note that lock holder instances are always assumed to be reusable and reentrant.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void acquireLock()
      Adds 1 to the internal lock counter.
      default void close()
      Releases the ownership of all locks represented by this object.
      static Lockable.LockHolder createBasicLockHolderFor(java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock lock)
      Creates a basic Lockable.LockHolder instance that operates on the given Lock.
      void releaseLock()
      Subtracts 1 from the internal lock counter, unlocking the lock if the counter reaches zero.

    • Method Detail

      • createBasicLockHolderFor

        static Lockable.LockHolder createBasicLockHolderFor(java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock lock)
        Creates a basic Lockable.LockHolder instance that operates on the given Lock.
        Parameters:
        lock - The lock to operate on. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The newly created lock holder. Never null.

      • close

        default void close()
        Releases the ownership of all locks represented by this object.

        All invocations after the first successful call to this method will be ignored and return immediately.

        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable

      • acquireLock

        void acquireLock()
        Adds 1 to the internal lock counter.

        Calling this method is usually not required. It is recommended to stick to the default Lockable.LockHolder pattern using try-with-resources statements.

        See Also:
        releaseLock()

      • releaseLock

        void releaseLock()
        Subtracts 1 from the internal lock counter, unlocking the lock if the counter reaches zero.

        Calling this method is usually not required. It is recommended to stick to the default Lockable.LockHolder pattern using try-with-resources statements.

        See Also:
        releaseLock()
